text: Why are you applying to join the SEC? How would your personal ambitions advance the mission of the SEC?
In what ways do you believe you embody the SEC mission statement (please use specific examples)?
Describe a time that you were faced with a difficult academic or extracurricular challenge, and explain how you handled it and what you learned.
What improvements could be made to the College of Engineering, and how would you like to see SEC contribute to this improvement (please be specific)?
Describe a notable accomplishment of yours, and in retrospect, how would you improve on it?
What are you passionate about and how can you apply that passion in our organization?
What are some personal qualities and/or experiences that make you a valuable candidate for the SEC?
Tell me about your proudest accomplishment. What is your favorite failure?
Tell me about a peer you look up to and why?
Would you consider yourself lucky?
How would you define humility?
What's your biggest personal goal and what are you doing to reach it?
What do you like to do when you're not working?
Tell me about at time you failed at something and what did you do?
How do you manage your time?
What would someone in your personal life say that you need to work on?
If you were starting a company, what kinds of people would you hire and why?
What kinds of things do you not like to do?
What kind of people annoy you the most and how do you deal with them?
Which of the three pillars from the SEC Mission Statement means the most to you and why?
Talk about an experience you had with a team. Describe your role and how you made an impact.
Describe a goal you set for yourself and how you determined your own success in achieving it.
What is one improvement to the College of Engineering that you believe SEC could contribute to? How would you go about addressing it?
Upon joining the council, all members are placed in a committee in which they will work with a team towards their committee's mission. How do you uniquely contribute to a team effort?
How do you see joining SEC as an avenue to work towards your personal growth?
In your opinion, what is the most important quality of a leader and why do you value that attribute?
How do you see joining SEC as an avenue to work towards your personal growth?
What skill sets or personality traits do you have that contribute to a team effort? Can you give a specific example within a team environment?
What impact do you want to make on the College of Engineering by being a member of the SEC?
Describe a time that you failed at something. How did you grow from that experience?
Talk about a time you enjoyed doing work. What did it look like and why did you enjoy it?
Describe a time when you used a creative/unique solution to solve a problem.
How would a friend describe you?
What are you passionate about and how can you apply that passion to SEC?
Which of the three pillars from the SEC Mission Statement means the most to you and why?
Describe a time when you realized you needed additional skills or knowledge to be successful. What was your approach to gaining these skills?
Talk about a time you saw an avenue for improvement and what you did to implement a solution.
What gets you out of the bed in the morning?
How would you define success for yourself if you were in SEC?
If you were forming a team, what qualities would you want to see in your team members?
In one sentence, what do you want to be remembered for?
How do you plan to incorporate a passion for helping others into your long-term professional goals, and how can that contribute to the mission of the Student Engineers' Council?

Reflect on a past experience where you demonstrated a strong commitment to achieving a goal outside of the classroom. What roadblocks did you face and what steps did you take to stay focused and dedicated?
List your top core values. Challenge: Describe a time when your core values were challenged. Not challenge: Describe a time when you implemented these core values, outside of the classroom
What goals do you have for your time within the Student Engineers' Council? Potential follow up: What steps do you plan on taking to accomplish these goals?
In three words, how do your friends describe you?
Which of the three pillars from the SEC Mission Statement means the most to you and why?
How did you define success in a goal you have set for yourself in the past?
Describe an experience that shaped your perspective on working with others?
Describe a time you served others.
How do you exemplify your core values?
Can you describe a time when you overcame a challenge?
What improvement could be made to the College of Engineering and if you had unlimited resources, how would you go about resolving it?
Can you share a project or initiative you were passionate about and how you would apply that to SEC?
What part of our mission resonates most with you, and how have you demonstrated a similar value in your life?
Describe a time when you had to make a difficult decision that not everyone agreed with. How did you handle the situation, and what was the outcome?
If you could create a new initiative or project for SEC, what would it be and why? Outline its objectives and potential impact.
Give me an example of when you demonstrated one of your strengths?
What is a lesson you learned from a failure or setback in life?
What does a positive organizational culture look like to you and and what tangible steps would you take to foster that culture?
What's one big risk you've taken in your academic, personal, or professional life? What did you learn from it?
What do you want us to remember most about you after this interview?
